Package eu.mihosoft.freerouting.geometry.planar

Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
eu.mihosoft.freerouting.geometry.planar.Polygon
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Polygon extends Object implements Serializable
A Polygon is a list of points in the plane, where no 2 consecutive points may be equal and no 3 consecutive points collinear.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Polygon(Point[] p_point_arr)
    Creates a polygon from p_point_arr.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Point[]
    corner_array()
    returns the array of corners of this polygon
    Polygon
    revert_corners()
    Reverts the order of the corners of this polygon.
    int
    winding_number_after_closing()
    Returns the winding number of this polygon, treated as closed.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Polygon

      public Polygon(Point[] p_point_arr)
      Creates a polygon from p_point_arr. Multiple points and points, which are collinear with its previous and next point will be removed.

  • Method Details

    • corner_array

      public Point[] corner_array()
      returns the array of corners of this polygon

    • revert_corners

      public Polygon revert_corners()
      Reverts the order of the corners of this polygon.

    • winding_number_after_closing

      public int winding_number_after_closing()
      Returns the winding number of this polygon, treated as closed. It will be > 0, if the corners are in countercock sense, and < 0, if the corners are in clockwise sense.
